column1: The surgery is done in the following way: - Your baby receives general anesthesia.
A pediatric surgeon has special training in surgery for babies and children.
Most babies who have gastroschisis are delivered by cesarean section.

Other treatments your baby will probably need after surgery are: - Antibiotics - Fluids and nutrients given through a vein - Oxygen - Pain medicines - A nasogastric (NG) tube placed through the nose into the stomach to drain the stomach and keep it empty Feedings are started through the NG tube as soon as your baby's bowel starts working after surgery.
After you go home, your child may develop a blockage in the intestines (bowel obstruction) due to a kink or scar in the intestines.
Some babies have gastroesophageal reflux after surgery.
Some babies with large omphaloceles may also have small lungs and may need to use a breathing machine.
